The help desk staff are really great - quick to answer, multiple methods of contact (chat, email, phone) and always provide the answers needed quickly.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about GreenRope?
review_question_answers.answer: Assets and file uploads are slow as you can only do one at a time.  I'm used to a campaign canvas type of tool that lets you drag and drop visually the elements of an email campaign for example  - where you create segment, attach email to segment, then determine all the subsequent steps based on the prospects interactions (open email, click through, form fill, purchase etc).  You can do the same functions in GR, but it is easier to visualize with it is a map.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
review_question_answers.answer: Great introduction to CRM and marketing automation tools at a great price.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
We have a very limited proprietary lead tool that our internal sales team currently uses, however there are a few different teams that are using Greenrope now since our tools don't fit their needs.   Managing a small list with some drip campaigns and tying in events has been very easy to manage, set up and report on.  Other teams are using the tool to market to other businesses so there is the B2B aspect that is beneficial.

We have limited email tools internally so using the email tool, templates and creating newsletters and other types of drip campaigns has also been very easy to use (even without html / coding background).

Having separate groups so that the lead / prospect data doesn't get cross messaged is important as well.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use with excellent support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
We have employees who have varying levels of computer experience. Even those with minimal computer skills are able to utilise GreenRope and its many features with ease. The interface is clean and easy to navigate and loads at a reasonable speed considering it is an online CRM (some we have experienced in the past have been very slow).

We also enjoy the speed in which the support team responds to our queries and there has not been an issue they have been unable to solve. The support team are easy to communicate with and don't speak 'above' us when giving technical assistance.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
There are some features that we would like GreenRope to have, to enable us to easily track communications with our customers. But we have been in touch with the technical team who have acknowledged our requests. While all of GreenRope's current features are fully functional, we realise the system is a work in progress with modifications and improvements being made frequently. At present it ticks most of our boxes, and we are patient in waiting for improvements to be made.

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
Ensure you correctly set up customer contact fields prior to importing contacts to GreenRope.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
The merge of direct marketing tracking and our general customer database is the best thing about GreenRope. Previously, we were using two different programmes to do the same thing GreenRope does with one. This has streamlined our business a lot.

all_reviews.review_title: GreenRope is the Swiss army knofe of marketing!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
GreenRope replaced a bunch of tools that we were using (and paying for) that were not connected.  Here's what we replaced with GreenRope:

1) EMAIL marketing
2) CRM System
3) Website tracking and analytics
4) Event registration
5) Website chat client
6) Help desk ticket system

And maybe some other stuff I can't remember now... *LOL*  The GreenRope platform brought these all under a single integrated system which made it easy to segregate contacts, do email blasts, track their website activity, announce and manage events, etc.  I think our total cost is about the same as with the other tools but all the data is in one place so we're not cutting and pasting into spreadsheets anymore and trying to get the different apps to talk to each other.  So we are saving time and streamlining our marketing / customer communications.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
The GreenRope platform is VERY feature rich which is a good thing.  However, this breadth of feature functionality does have a cost.  The system is not super intuitive to use and the GUI is not as smooth and updated as some other apps.  Because all the functions are integrated, it takes some time to figure out how all the data flows together and there is a LOT more to learn.  In addition, the system is customiseable, which in general is good, but this again results in adding some complexity to the platform.  If you just want a casual CRM system or email blast system, GreenRope is probably more (and more complex) than you need.  When you get bigger though and want to start integrating some of your marketing activities, GreenRope should be on your short list.

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
Do a trial first if possible.  GreenRope is not the most intuitive system to use.  If you manage websites, use WordPress and have used EMAIL systems before, you should get the hang of GreenRope and their support has been very good.  But if you are a small business owner and just need to send out an email newsletter once a month, GreenRope may be overkill for you.  It is more aimed at B2B and more power users than casual users.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were looking for an integrated CRM/email/marketing system to help us stay in touch with current customers and market to prospects to try and move them to be paying customers.  What used to take 4 or 5 different tools that did not talk to each other is all handled now by GreenRope which has saved us time and helped us keep in better contact with customers and prospects alike.

all_reviews.review_title: Many Challenges with the set up and not user friendly for multiple departments
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
1) the custom emails and live data sharing is a great asset
2) Technical Assistant team is amoung the best ive ever dealt with

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
1) Not having an easy way  to set up different departments
2) constrainst on permissions makes it very difficult to work with
3) challenges with exporting data makes it very difficult to make major changes within the data
4) too many restrictions for users


Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
At this point if it was a one department company I would definitely recommend greenrope but for multiple department company there are way too many challenges with permissions that it does not make sense to put my name on the line given the challenges we have seen.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
We do weekly customized email outs to our advertisers and this program allows us to contact our 2000 plus businesses who fall under the categories we need. These emails account for approximately 5 to 10% of our monthly revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: After 15 years of looking for a comprehensive CRM platform... Greenrope is a fit for us.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
GreenRope's support staff is exceptional. The company is transparent and always improving the platform based on feedback from users. I especially enjoy the webinars with Lars, the CEO about new features and planned improvements. I also like their straightforward pricing and not having to pay monthly fees to third parties for integrations. It's all included with GreenRope for a reasonable monthly fee.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
I dislike the idea that I spent so much time and money trying to learn and implement other platforms. I've used and trained people on everything from ACT and Goldmine to Salesforce and Infusionsoft. I don't even want to think about how many hours and dollars I could have saved with GreenRope.

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
Try it and then take the time to learn how to use it. Your time will be well spent.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have an executive team that is spread out from coast to coast. We were looking for a system to coordinate sales and support, track our own projects, and be able to record all forms of communication including email, voice calls, and SMS exchanges. GreenRope does all this and more.

all_reviews.review_title: GreenRope is Working For My Business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
I like the way GreenRope allows me to communicate with clients and prospects, track my results, and manage my projects in one area. Every action and interaction is attached to that client's record. I can see the history at a glance. I also love the one-to-one training to help me get started. I am not an IT person and I could not have made the transition to GreenRope without their excellent support.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
1. I use a MacBookPro and some of the navigating is a bit cumbersome. If GreenRope could fix that, I'd have no complaints.
2. Starting up on GreenRope forced me think far more systematically than I was used to thinking. I hated it in the beginning. Now, I am so glad I rose to the challenge. The systems are in place and easy for me to use.

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
I would like it to work more seamlessly with my MAC Book Pro - specifically the scroll function. I would love to use GreenRope for my book-keeping, but I've been told it's not quite there yet. As I am not a graphics person, I have to size a graphic before I upload it and it is hard to tell what size a graphic needs to be, so I have to do a lot of trial and error. I'd either like a more robust photo editing tool or a cheat on each template that tells you the pixels or incches a photo or graphic needs to be in order to fit there.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. I am preparing material for a year-long drip campaign to my subscribers. I was using Mail Chimp and I could not create the kind of campaign I am working on with that tool.
2. I am tracking the results of my regular email and e-newsletter communication. I can see at a glance what the overall effectiveness and open rates are. I can see who is opening, clicking and taking action. When I send an individual email to a client or contact, that message is connected to their file. I can never lose track of a communication.
3. I am using it to manage customer relations, communication, commitments and the results. I am reducing my use of a paper back-up system, staying on top of my calls and call-backs. It is much simpler to manage.

all_reviews.review_title: I like GreenRope and it is the only CRM I use.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
I can get to a client record from the Dash Board screen by entering a portion of their name, company name or email address.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
It has tons of features which is great but I don't use most of them and some of them are very complicated.  I wish there were a way to seamlessly integrate GreenRope with my company email but I have explored this with corporate and there is not an easy fix.

Also it would be great if there were an easy way to scan a client's business card (front and back) and load the image in their CRM record.  I know I can add their photo but being able to add and image of their business card would be far more beneficial for me.

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
Purchase the product and take time to go through the tutorials and attend the webinars.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am able to keep track of all of my clients and categorize them by their respective interests in businesses I have listed for sale.  Again the feature of being able to pull up a client record by entering a portion of their name, company name or email address is a huge benefit.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about GreenRope?
review_question_answers.answer: I can get to a client record from the Dash Board screen by entering a portion of their name, company name or email address.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about GreenRope?
review_question_answers.answer:
It has tons of features which is great but I don't use most of them and some of them are very complicated.  I wish there were a way to seamlessly integrate GreenRope with my company email but I have explored this with corporate and there is not an easy fix.

Also it would be great if there were an easy way to scan a client's business card (front and back) and load the image in their CRM record.  I know I can add their photo but being able to add and image of their business card would be far more beneficial for me.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
review_question_answers.answer: Purchase the product and take time to go through the tutorials and attend the webinars.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: I am able to keep track of all of my clients and categorize them by their respective interests in businesses I have listed for sale.  Again the feature of being able to pull up a client record by entering a portion of their name, company name or email address is a huge benefit.

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic Customer Service and Simple but Robust Email Marketing and More
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
What I like best about GreenRope is the customer service - including the very knowledgeable and accessible expertise on bounce and spam filtering challenges - and the price! I've worked with all the big Marketing Automation and Email Marketing Platforms and a lot of the smaller ones too. GreenRope is better than all of them at keeping their customer service promises. They train you well and they understand the both limitations of their system and (whether those limitations are intentional - to protect us from ourselves - or on the roadmap to be improved). For medium sized emailers the system does a LOT of what the big marketing automation platforms can do for a lot less money.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
Some of the contact management side of things is a little clunky - requires one or two more steps than perhaps necessary. But whatever you need to do can get done. Also, it's a bit too easy to set up and send a campaign using the wrong "group" which can make reporting by group error prone.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
Better bounce management - which means more clicks and more long term and near term value - plus lower monthly costs for a medium sized non-profit client.

all_reviews.review_title: Full-featured, steep learning curve, great support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
Greenroom's customer service support is outstanding. From chat to email to support from your sales person. Messages are answered promptly, and if the person you are working with does not have the answer, he or she will find to for you. No complaints!!! The platform appears full featured and meets most small/medium businesses' CRM and sales automation needs.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
There is a steep learning curve and the help menu rarely seem to provide the answers, especially to what is assumed basic questions, however a quick chat usually solves the issue. My biggest challenge is that the platform is not intuitive at all and you will need training to fully understand the workings. The platform too is a bit clunky and old fashioned looking, it is not responsive and the app for iPhone does not meet the needs of an on the go sales person, especially annoying since the site is not responsive and can't be used on phone or tablet easily.

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
Make sure you have a really good understanding of what you are trying to accomplish before getting into the system, and assign enough time to learn. Know that everything is group and individual based and not company based, causing some issues if you are used to tracking company vs. individual.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sales Automation, inbound and outbound sales, workflow management and drip campaigns.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
the integration of email blasts with the website, so you can track both who is opening your emails and if they are showing up on your website.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
I don't that I dislike it as much as I don't believe it is the best fit for a company my size (5 employees). Without a person that is dedicating a healthy amount of time to the site, it is a bit pointless. I don't know what size a company becomes before they have a web marketing person, but we are not there.

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
make sure that you have a marketing plan and a dedicated amount of time to keep putting time into it. It is also helpful to know if your product or service is something that people buy from the web. I don't know that CPAs and Accountants get hired because of their web content.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
we switched to greenrope because we wanted to integrate our website into our marketing push, to have something more than a web brochure type website. We could upload our vimeo videos to our site and then integrate that with an email blast. it was great.

all_reviews.review_title: I use GreenRope for it's CRM capability and Website management
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
It's easy to use and has very helpful tutorials and quick reference guides.  Also, there are online webinar trainings.  The support team is very helpful and responsive. The system itself is pretty user friendly and has almost any capability you need for full CRM and Website Management.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
You cannot toggle between windows in GR i.e, if you are writing an email template and click another tab in GR, you lose what you were working on if you didn't save it.  Every time you click to a different tab, it resets they previous page you were on, so if you pull up a contact list and filter it a specific way, go to another tab and come back, you have to start over.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
Database management and event management.

Greenrope does not work for B2B companies. It's not capable of handling the kind of complex sales processes that B2Bs require.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
We tried several other CRM's before settling on GreenRope.  Calling it a CRM doesn't really cover all it does. Most other systems either did just broadcast email or were so huge (and expensive) you practically needed a dedicated IT department to run it.  GreenRope is both robust and easy to use. I cant say there's no learning curve but once you do it a few times it's fairly simple.  Importing or adding contacts is easy - even for me.  We can measure everything from who clicks links in our emails to the number of website visits by day or hour.  We can see who visits our website and where they come from.  It really is a complete online marketing tool designed for the small business owner.  On the times I did have questions their customer support was very fast and courteous.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
The weakest part (if I have to pick one) is probably the website builder tool.  That's not a huge issue because you can build a site with Wordpress or another tool and embed the GreenRope code to track activity.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
We need feedback on how many people were reading our emails and visiting our webpage to track the effectiveness of our communications.

all_reviews.review_title: Greenrope is a comprehensive, affordable CMS system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
We are a very small (>10 employees) company, and Greenrope is the perfect solution for our email marketing and client management system. It is affordable but provides us with all of the options we need to manage existing clients and potential leads, send out emails, and track leads on our website. We are very happy with the platform, and the customer service is excellent. I'm able to chat with someone at almost any hour of the day or night and receive a quick, experienced answer.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
The admin is simple and at times a bit clunky. It's not as sleek as other more expensive options, but because it provides us with what we need, I can get past it.

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
Try out a trial version. Utilize the excellent library of training webinars and materials. And don't be afraid to use the customer support!

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to easily manage existing clients, track potential leads, send out marketing emails, and track leads on our website.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
We chose to migrate our entire marketing automation implementation from another product to GreenRope because of its holistic and expanded features and capabilities that make it so much more relevant in our line of business. One of the main lead generation methods for our company are client events and with GreenRope, we utilize the Event Management feature to capture prospect information from the outset and with the integration of the CRM (client database), Marketing Drip Automation and our Internal Process Workflow we are effectively connecting with the prospect both on-line and off-line. Our objective is to create world class client experience and we feel that GreenRope, from a technology perspective, is helping us achieve that objective.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
So far there is nothing major that we dislike about GreenRope. There are some minor incidents that we've come across as we continue to get familiar with the the product but overall we are satisfied with it.

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
I recommend having the marketing content ready for the drip automation portion and knowing the specific data requirements of your business for creation of the user defined fields in the CRM in order to expedite the implementation of the system

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
We'd like to standardize our business processes and enforce the standardization through automation in order to maximize our business' throughput and productivity; GreenRope as the platform for automation and process management has been great because we don't have to look at several product offerings patched together to help us move towards that direction.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
GreenRope has made my business almost 100% automated. The drip campaigns were easy to set up and the ability to trigger workflows based on certain criteria is just awesome! The support team has probably some of the fastest response time and email tracking is a pretty cool feature.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
There aren't too many things I don't like, so I'm really being picky here.

- Phone numbers aren't formatted. So, instead of 555-123-4567, it's 5551234567. Silly, I know, but still kind of a pain.
- Drip campaigns can't be sent out only on business days...instead of M-F, it's M-Sun. I'd like that option.
- I can't post date the start of a campaign, so I have to set a reminder on that date to go in and start a campaign manually.

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
There is a learning curve for this software, but it's not as bad as you think. Don't look at it as some daunting task that will take forever to set up. Once you get it, it will be easy and you'll love how much time you've saved in the long run.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm able to move people from campaign to campaign automatically using GreenRope's workflows. I hadn't been able to find a software program that could take that part out for me, so it's really makes me feel good when I get a notification that a contact moved themselves along in the hiring process.

The team is incredibly friendly and helpful.

all_reviews.review_title: Very robust system especially for those more techie.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about GreenRope?
All the functions.  CMS, opt-in forms,  social media management from one screen, auto-responders, multiple groups with each group having own functions.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
the group calendars, limited customization unlike google calendar which is more user friendly.  CMS does not integrate with LeadPages :(

Recommendations to others considering GreenRope:
They are constantly improving user friendly features as experienced in  products like  Infusion Soft.  Though you can do so much more with Greenrope than Infusion Soft.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
creating drip campaigns with autoresponders solves time issues in business once it's set up, it's done and can be adjusted at any time.  Do the upfront work now and get paid forever if it's a product based service.

What do you like best about GreenRope?
GreenRope is a comprehensive product that really looks to help companies create robust closed-loop marketing systems. The team is very response and happy to help your team be successful.

What do you dislike about GreenRope?
The event module requires a double opt in that may confuse some clients.

What problems is GreenRope solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were looking for a CRM that helped us understand how our constituents were interacting with our brand online and at our events. GreenRope gives us visibility into these interactions and helps us be more data-driven marketers.
